The prime minister, who has obviously been very supportive of Andy Coulson , did not want him to resign. But the prime minister did accept that the pressure had made it difficult for him to do the job at 110%. who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside.`` Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago,`` Eric Schmidt lost some href="http://www.earthtimes.org/tag/energy.html"> energy and focus.`` Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaKen Auletta by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. Together with the co- founders, he decided to step aside.In announcing the move Thursday, Eric Schmidt said that the company no longer needed his`` adult supervision and that Page, 38, was ready to run the world's leading href="http://www.earthtimes.org/tag/internet.html"> internet company.`` We have been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a
